data.meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
data.sentence: The word هُدًى comes from the root ه د ي and is associated with the meanings: to guide/direct to the way, take/follow right way/course, rightly guided/directed, a way/course/method/mode/manner of conduct. Gift.
The word عَنْ comes from the root ع ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word وَفِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.
data.sentence: The word وَرَحْمَةٌ comes from the root ر ح م and is associated with the meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.
The word أَخَذَ comes from the root ا خ ذ and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: To change colour, become visible, gleam/shine, light up, scorching one, broad table or plate, tablet.
data.sentence: The word الْأَلْوَاحَ comes from the root ل و ح and is associated with the meanings: To change colour, become visible, gleam/shine, light up, scorching one, broad table or plate, tablet.
The word سَكَتَ comes from the root س ك ت and is associated with the meanings: to be silent, appeased, abated.
The word الْغَضَبُ comes from the root غ ض ب and is associated with the meanings: anger/wrath/stern, intense/deep redness

data.meanings: to abolish, destroy, abrogate, nullify, obliterate, conceal, transfer, substitute, copy, transcribe, rule out.
data.sentence: The word نُسْخَتِهَا comes from the root ن س خ and is associated with the meanings: to abolish, destroy, abrogate, nullify, obliterate, conceal, transfer, substitute, copy, transcribe, rule out.

data.meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.
data.sentence: The word لِرَبِّهِمْ comes from the root ر ب ب and is associated with the meanings: to be a lord and master, collect, possess/owner, rule, increase, complete, bring up, preserve, chief, determiner, provider, sustainer, perfecter, rewarder, creator, maintainer, reposer of properties, developer, former of rules and laws of the growth, foster a thing in such a manner as to make it attain one condition after another until it reaches its goal of completion.

data.meanings: to fear/dread/terrify, terror, awe. rahibun (pl. ruhban) - monk, monasticism, monkery.
data.sentence: The word يَرْهَبُونَ comes from the root ر ه ب and is associated with the meanings: to fear/dread/terrify, terror, awe. rahibun (pl. ruhban) - monk, monasticism, monkery.
